summary.long: 2 Timothy is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, to further the promise of life in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to Timothy, my dear child. Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am thankful to God, whom I have served with a clear conscience as my ancestors did, when I remember you in my prayers as I do constantly night and day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I remember your tears, I long to see you, so that I may be filled with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I recall your sincere faith that was alive first in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice, and I am sure is in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this I remind you to rekindle God’s gift that you possess through the laying on of my hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God did not give us a Spirit of fear but of power and love and self-control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not be ashamed of the testimony about our Lord or of me, a prisoner for his sake, but by God’s power accept your share of suffering for the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the one who saved us and called us with a holy calling, not based on our works but on his own purpose and grace, granted to us in Christ Jesus before time began,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but now made visible through the appearing of our Savior Christ Jesus. He has broken the power of death and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this gospel I was appointed a preacher and apostle and teacher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this, in fact, I suffer as I do. But I am not ashamed, because I know the one in whom my faith is set and I am convinced that he is able to protect what has been entrusted to me until that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hold to the standard of sound words that you heard from me and do so with the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Protect that good thing entrusted to you, through the Holy Spirit who lives within us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that everyone in the province of Asia deserted me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord grant mercy to the family of Onesiphorus, because he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my imprisonment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he arrived in Rome, he eagerly searched for me and found me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord grant him to find mercy from the Lord on that day! And you know very well all the ways he served me in Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you, my child, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what you heard me say in the presence of many witnesses entrust to faithful people who will be competent to teach others as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take your share of suffering as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one in military service gets entangled in matters of everyday life; otherwise he will not please the one who recruited him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, if anyone competes as an athlete, he will not be crowned as the winner unless he competes according to the rules.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The farmer who works hard ought to have the first share of the crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Think about what I am saying and the Lord will give you understanding of all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, a descendant of David; such is my gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which I suffer hardship to the point of imprisonment as a criminal, but God’s message is not imprisoned!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I endure all things for the sake of those chosen by God, that they too may obtain salvation in Christ Jesus and its eternal glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This saying is trustworthy:
If we died with him, we will also live with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If we endure, we will also reign with him.
If we deny him, he will also deny us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we are unfaithful, he remains faithful, since he cannot deny himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remind people of these things and solemnly charge them before the Lord not to wrangle over words. This is of no benefit; it just brings ruin on those who listen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make every effort to present yourself before God as a proven worker who does not need to be ashamed, teaching the message of truth accurately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But avoid profane chatter, because those occupied with it will stray further and further into ungodliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their message will spread its infection like gangrene. Hymenaeus and Philetus are in this group.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have strayed from the truth by saying that the resurrection has already occurred, and they are undermining some people’s faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, God’s solid foundation remains standing, bearing this seal: “The Lord knows those who are his,” and “Everyone who confesses the name of the Lord must turn away from evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in a wealthy home there are not only gold and silver vessels, but also ones made of wood and of clay, and some are for honorable use, but others for ignoble use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if someone cleanses himself of such behavior, he will be a vessel for honorable use, set apart, useful for the Master, prepared for every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But keep away from youthful passions, and pursue righteousness, faithfulness, love, and peace, in company with others who call on the Lord from a pure heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But reject foolish and ignorant controversies, because you know they breed infighting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord’s slave must not engage in heated disputes but be kind toward all, an apt teacher, patient,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: correcting opponents with gentleness. Perhaps God will grant them repentance and then knowledge of the truth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will come to their senses and escape the devil’s trap where they are held captive to do his will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But understand this, that in the last days difficult times will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For people will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, ungrateful, unholy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unloving, irreconcilable, slanderers, without self-control, savage, opposed to what is good,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: treacherous, reckless, conceited, loving pleasure rather than loving God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will maintain the outward appearance of religion but will have repudiated its power. So avoid people like these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For some of these insinuate themselves into households and captivate weak women who are overwhelmed with sins and led along by various passions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such women are always seeking instruction, yet never able to arrive at a knowledge of the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so these people—who have warped minds and are disqualified in the faith—also oppose the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will not go much further, for their foolishness will be obvious to everyone, just like it was with Jannes and Jambres.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, however, have followed my teaching, my way of life, my purpose, my faith, my patience, my love, my endurance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as well as the persecutions and sufferings that happened to me in Antioch, in Iconium, and in Lystra. I endured these persecutions and the Lord delivered me from them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in fact all who want to live godly lives in Christ Jesus will be persecuted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But evil people and charlatans will go from bad to worse, deceiving others and being deceived themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, however, must continue in the things you have learned and are confident about. You know who taught you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how from infancy you have known the holy writings, which are able to give you wisdom for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every scripture is inspired by God and useful for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the person dedicated to God may be capable and equipped for every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I solemnly charge you before God and Christ Jesus, who is going to judge the living and the dead, and by his appearing and his kingdom:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Preach the message, be ready whether it is convenient or not, reprove, rebuke, exhort with complete patience and instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there will be a time when people will not tolerate sound teaching. Instead, following their own desires, they will accumulate teachers for themselves, because they have an insatiable curiosity to hear new things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will turn away from hearing the truth, but on the other hand they will turn aside to myths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, however, be self-controlled in all things, endure hardship, do an evangelist’s work, fulfill your ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am already being poured out as an offering, and the time for me to depart is at hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have competed well; I have finished the race; I have kept the faith!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally the crown of righteousness is reserved for me. The Lord, the righteous Judge, will award it to me in that day—and not to me only, but also to all who have set their affection on his appearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make every effort to come to me soon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Demas deserted me, since he loved the present age, and he went to Thessalonica. Crescens went to Galatia and Titus to Dalmatia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only Luke is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, because he is a great help to me in ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you come, bring with you the cloak I left in Troas with Carpas and the scrolls, especially the parchments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Alexander the coppersmith did me a great deal of harm. The Lord will repay him in keeping with his deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You be on guard against him too, because he vehemently opposed our words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At my first defense no one appeared in my support; instead they all deserted me—may they not be held accountable for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord stood by me and strengthened me, so that through me the message would be fully proclaimed for all the Gentiles to hear. And so I was delivered from the lion’s mouth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will deliver me from every evil deed and will bring me safely into his heavenly kingdom. To him be glory for ever and ever! Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greetings to Prisca and Aquila and the family of Onesiphorus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Erastus stayed in Corinth. Trophimus I left ill in Miletus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make every effort to come before winter. Greetings to you from Eubulus, Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers and sisters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
